meanings.sent1: The sneaky fox hornswoggled the rabbit out of its carrots.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed after being hornswoggled by the magician's trick.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat hornswoggled the dog into thinking the ball was still there.
meanings.sent4: The con artist hornswoggled innocent people out of their hard-earned money.
meanings.sent5: The clever detective finally caught the criminal who had hornswoggled many victims.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest salesman hornswoggled customers into buying overpriced products.
meanings.sent2: He realized he had been hornswoggled when he saw the fake designer watch he bought.
meanings.sent3: The tricky leprechaun hornswoggled the children into giving him their candy.
meanings.sent4: The scammer hornswoggled unsuspecting individuals with promises of easy money.
meanings.sent5: The cunning pirate hornswoggled the crew out of their share of the treasure.
